Animist
  • About
  • Components
  • Use Cases
  • Contact

An open source project developing tools to enable
location-aware Ethereum contracts.

Find Out More

Under construction Spring/Summer 2016

Components in development include mobile and IoT applications that can execute location contingent or proximity triggered contract clauses without requiring a user's intentional engagement, as well as an API to help people define and manage these on the Ethereum blockchain.

Components

Whale Island

An Ethereum node on a Rasberry Pi which seamlessly connects to nearby Animist mobile clients over Bluetooth BLE. A local Node.js server intermediates the mobile client and Ethereum, authenticating events and registering them with relevant contracts on the blockchain.

Wowshuxkluh

Javascript APIs for IOS/Android which let apps link an Ethereum account to Animist IOT endpoints. This allows developers to build seamless location-contingent value transfers into any mobile application. Additional modules enable contract semantics that incorporate sensor data collected from the mobile device.

Wallowa

An API for Solidity that lets contracts be written around Animist proximity events and handles the mechanics of publishing these to the blockchain.

Wolves

An online tool to help translate natural language contract ideas into code that can be executed by Animist components on Ethereum. A Web UI that helps people build arbitrarily complex event specifications for real space and time that result in a contractual value exchange. A place to register and display Animist IOT assets and define the cost of using them.

Use case #1: Human Race

A mobile app for competitive running that pays

Two runners in New York want to bet each other $20 on a race across the Williamsburg Bridge. There's an app for that: Human Race. It helps them find two Animist enabled locations near either end of the bridge - a small bakery in LES and a natural foods store on Broadway in Brooklyn. The app can tap into these IOT nodes to authenticate the runners' presence and execute conditional payment contracts on the Ethereum chain.

They meet at the bakery and register the bet through their phones, transferring $20 from their digital wallets into an escrow contract. The app fires a starting shot. Whoever reaches the natural foods store first is detected by its Animist endpoint and automatically gets the proceeds of the wager.

Human Race also permits side bets on this race in jurisdictions where casual betting is legal. It sets aside a portion of that betting pool for a jackpot awarded to the race winner. Maybe the winner gets more than $20! Maybe not. Depends on their social media connections to people in England.

Contact

Animist is on GitHub and actively seeking contributors. Feel free to fork the repo for any component you're interested in and make a pull request.

christophergewecke@gmail.com
